intro: Gomphandra montana, commonly known as the mountain gomphandra, is a rare and elusive plant found in high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes aromatic herbs and some poisonous species. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and finely divided leaves, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
